humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 8 x 7.5 x 5 cm, which is more than 5 cm in the largest dimension. Following the rules provided, this corresponds to a pathologic T stage of T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor is a right-sided infiltrating lobular carcinoma, Nottingham grade II, with a mass size of 8 x 7.5 x 5 cm. The AJCC pT staging system classifies a tumor with a size greater than 5 cm as pT3. The report explicitly states 'AJCC pT3', which supports the T3 stage prediction. The reasoning is based on the size of the tumor being larger than 5 cm, which is the criterion for T3 staging in the AJCC system.
